title: Alan Shearer accuses Sadio Mane of diving to win Liverpool's penalty against Leicester City
text:
Alan Shearer has accused Sadio Mane of diving to win Liverpool's injury-time penalty in their 2-1 win over Leicester City at Anfield on Saturday.

Mane went to ground inside the area under pressure from Marc Albrighton, with referee Chris Kavanagh pointing to the spot.

VAR upheld Kavanagh's original decision and James Milner converted from the spot to extend Liverpool's lead at the top of the table to eight points.

Alan Shearer says Sadio Mane dived to win Liverpool's injury-time equaliser against Leicester

James Milner converted from the spot to extend Liverpool's lead at the top to eight points

A brawl unfolded after the game as Leicester vented their frustration at their late defeat

After the game an angry brawl unfolded between both sets of players, as Leicester vented their frustration at their late defeat and Shearer felt they were right to feel aggrieved.

'I don’t think it’s a penalty, I think it’s a dive,' said Shearer on Match of the Day. 'It’s a contact sport. Mane takes a touch against Albrighton and then decides to go down.'

Shearer's view echoed the sentiments of Leicester boss Brendan Rodgers, who said after the game that the penalty wasn't 'clear and obvious' and shouldn't have been given.

Liverpool had earlier taken the lead through Mane's cool finish on 40 minutes but James Maddison looked to have salvaged a point for Leicester with his 80th minute strike.

But Milner's injury-time penalty denied Rodgers a point on his first return to Anfield since he was sacked by the club in 2015.

Victory for Liverpool means they have now won 17 consecutive games and are just one win short of equalling Manchester City's record of 18.
description: Alan Shearer has accused Sadio Mane of deliberately making contact with Marc Albrighton to win Liverpool's injury-time penalty in their 2-1 win over Leicester City at Anfield on Saturday.
